str2: Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

word: they led him by the hand
parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lead by the hand. From cheiragogos; to be a hand-leader, i.e. To guide.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Damascus. Of Hebrew origin; Damascus, a city of Syria.
